weather_report:
As night settles over Evanston, conditions are chilly, with a current temperature in the low 20s. The air carries a brisk chill, accentuated by fierce gusts making their presence known along the shoreline. Clouds blanket the sky, rendering visibility limited, while the scene is defined by a muted palette of evening tones. Looking ahead, the forecast promises a transition tonight to mostly cloudy skies with temperatures edging up slightly, hovering around the mid-20s. 

Tomorrow, scattered snow showers are set to make an appearance after 2 PM, with the mercury reaching near 38 before settling back into the low 30s by afternoon. Winds will shift to a blustery west-southwest, adding to the chilliness. Given these conditions, it's advisable to bundle up warmly if venturing outdoors. The waves on Lake Michigan may be somewhat lively, stirred by strong winds, though minimal snow accumulation is expected. While outdoor activities are limited tonight, tomorrow’s weather could bring a wintery walk or the chance to enjoy the enchanting allure of falling flakes, reminding us that the season is firmly upon us in this part of the Midwest.
